text: Traditional antiviral therapy has relied on small molecules such as protease inhibitors or nucleotide analogues to inhibit viral enzymes . In the last decades , proteins and nucleic acid molecules have shown very promising antiviral properties . However , due to their physical properties , such as size or hydrophilicity , the cellular uptake of these molecules is strongly restricted . The inability of these molecules to cross the cell membrane to reach their intracellular target precludes further clinical application . The cellular delivery of these molecules has thus arisen as a cornerstone for therapeutic development .
